required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Machine-learning Model for Perioperative Risk Calculation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this project is to develop a machine-learning model for calculating the risk of postoperative complications. In addition to the data collected during the premedication, the model will include all intraoperative values recorded in the Patient Data Management System (PDMS), which include not only vital and respiratory parameters, but also medication and doses, intraoperative events and times. Postoperative complications are defined according to their severity according to the Clavien-Dindo score (Dindo, Demartines et al., 2004) and are collected from the data available in the health information system (HIS).

primary_outcome.description: Postoperative complications are classified by means of the Clavien-Dindo-Score. The Clavien-Dindo-Score describes classes of severity of postoperative complications: Grade I: any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological interventions Grade II: requiring pharmacological treatment Grade IIIa: requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention not under general anesthesia Grade IIIb: requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention under general anesthesia Grade IVa: single organ dysfunction Grade IVb: multiorgandysfunction Grade V: death of a patient

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent surgical interventions with general or regional anesthesia at Klinikum rechts der Isar, Munich after the implementation of an electronic patient data management system in May 2014

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients who underwent surgery with anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
